intro: Bieneria boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian bieneria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
